page.title: 13Landscape: Wray, Roeburndale
page.content: The landscape of Wray and Roeburndale is very beautiful, speckled with flowers, and with an abundance of deciduous and coniferous trees in varying shades of green. Several different types of field can be seen, some used for grazing land and others where the grass grows long for hay and silage. Higher up on the fells is wetland where rushes grow. Looking down from the fells, you can see the patchwork fields spotted with sheep and cows, and below them the village built of Pennine stone, a fairy-tale village in a picture book valley. The rivers, Roeburn and Hindburn, flow down from the fells to meet just beyond Wray Bridge in a deep pool called Black Dub. The entire area is a joy to see.
